channel.title: Taebaek-si on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Taebaek Snow Festival, a country of exhilarating snow - Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do, Korea
item.description:
Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo Credit, Lieto>

Taebaek Snow Festival, a country of exhilarating snow

Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do, Korea

Taebaek, Gangwon-do, is home to the Baekdu-daegan, including Taebaeksan, Hambaeksan, and Manhangjae.
The snow festival held in winter every year in Taebaek is a festival where you can enjoy the beauty of Taebaek becoming a snow country. Enjoy the snow sculpture exhibition, snow festival program, and climb the famous Baeksan Mountain in Korea to see the beautiful snow flowers.
Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo Credit, Lieto>
Everything you can enjoy with snow and ice
The 21st Taebaeksan Snow Festival, where you can capture fantastic snow sculptures and picturesque snow scenes of Taebaeksan, is held at Taebaeksan National Park for 10 days from January 17th (Friday) to 26th (Sunday).
Fashionable snow sculptures, the core of the snow festival <Photo courtesy, Rietto>
The heart of the Taebaeksan Snow Festival is a magnificent yet delicate and stylish snow sculpture that reflects the flow of the times. The Taebaeksan Snow Festival, which marks its 21st anniversary this year, has diversified the subject of snow sculptures and expanded its scale to meet the various needs of tourists based on 20 years of know-how.
Fashionable snow sculptures, the core of the snow festival <Photo courtesy, Rietto>
You can easily find huge snow sculptures that are great for leaving commemorative photos in Taebaeksan National Park, the driving company, and all over downtown Taebaek.
Fashionable snow sculptures, the core of the snow festival <Photo courtesy, Rietto>
If you are looking for the 2014 Taebaeksan Snow Festival, you can meet magnificent and delicate snow sculptures completed by the best snow sculptors in Korea. In the Danggol Square, large-sized snow sculptures enter, and the square under the Majanggong site is filled with interesting snow sculptures. The thrilling vinyl snow sled, the ice slide frame popular with children, and the igloo cafe, which is good to talk about, are basic! Hwangji Pond, the public parking lot behind the Taebaek Tourist Information Center, Taebaek Station Plaza, O2 Resort, Jungang-ro, etc.
Igloo Cafe <Photo courtesy, Rieto>
It is planning to make Gwanghwamun with super large snow sculptures representing the 21st Snow Festival. In addition, Crayon Pop, King Sejong, Geobukseon, General Yi Sun-sin, World Cup Stadium, and Cheonjedan will catch the attention of tourists.
Igloo Cafe <Photo courtesy, Rieto>
The dog sledding and snowmobile experience in the sol field in front of Taebaeksanminbakchon is crowded with family tourists with children.
Different things to enjoy at the Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo courtesy, Rieto>
It is also a pleasure to ride a sled pulled by a Siberian husky, which shows the instinct of a gallop on a snowy field. It is more popular because it allows you to leave a commemorative photo with a real brownie (Siberian Husky) that is more realistic than a ‘genuine brownie’.
Different things to enjoy at the Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo courtesy, Rieto>
In addition, various plays such as ice sled, ice slide, and snow slide make the cold forgetful.
Different things to enjoy at the Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo courtesy, Rieto>
Making snow briquettes, making snowman mini lanterns, making snow candles, etc. makes the experience of using snow and ice timeless.
Different things to enjoy at the Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo courtesy, Rieto>
The Starlight Festival held in the city along with the Taebaeksan Snow Festival provides an unforgettable world of light to tourists visiting Taebaek.
Different things to enjoy at the Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo courtesy, Rieto>
Hwangji Pond, Jungang-ro, and Taebaek Station are decorated with colorful lights and sculptures that attract people's attention.
Different things to enjoy at the Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo courtesy, Rieto>
Another festival-like fun, to Taebaeksan Snow Blossom Mountain
Taebaeksan Snow Festival is held at Taebaeksan National Park. It's a pity to pass Taebaek Mountain. What's more, if it snows, how much do you pass by the dazzling snowflake that has dazzlingly beautiful snowflakes and white snow!
In Taebaeksan, bright pink azaleas form a line in spring, and snow-white snowflake is spectacular in winter. The main peaks are Janggunbong Peak (1,567m), Munsubong Peak, and Busobong Peak, which extend from north to south. The trail to climb the Taebaek Mountain is largely divided into the Danggol Course and the Yuilsa Course. The billiard course has the advantage of having a lot of sights, and the only course has the advantage of being easy to climb for both men and women due to the gentle slope. If you climb up the only course and descend to the Danggol Course, you can enjoy the true nature of Taebaeksan Mountain.
Hiker crossing the Taebaeksan yew community
The only course can reach the summit in 2 hours or so, about 4km to the top of Taebaeksan Mountain. The steep mountain path from the ticket office to the only resting place leads to zigzag. It's a breathtaking section, but it's easy to go uphill to the Cheonjedan just to the only resting place. It is difficult to breathe due to the difficult climb, but the sky and the Baekdudaegan ridge between the forests gradually enter the field of view. As the summit approaches, it passes the attention colony of 'Alive, Thousand Years of Death, Thousand Years of Death'. The deep blue life is intense on the branches of attention standing tall in the wind.
Taebaeksan summit cover stone

After passing the attention colony, it reaches the peak of Janggunbong. At the top of Janggunbong, there is an altar made of stones. Together with the generals of Janggunbong, the bottom of the road to Yeongbong's Cheonwangdan and Busobong is also called the Cheonjedan. It is an altar established by ancestors for a long time to perform sacrifices in the sky. Even among the stacked stones, the snowflake blooms white and looks like a large igloo. Put the thrilling snow scene in your eyes and go down to Dangol Valley through Danjonggak, Mangyeongsa and Banjae. The Hassan Course is 4.4km and takes about 2 hours.

Taebaeksan Cheonjedan
500 km long journey of water, Hwangji Pond and Geomryongso
The Han River and the Nakdong River are the representative rivers of Korea. Taebaek is the origin of these two rivers, and the site of more than 500 km of water begins. The Nakdong River originates from the Hwangji Pond, passes through the gate to the Namhae, soaking the fields of Gyeongsangnam-do and North Korea, and the Han River flows from Geomyongso to the West Sea through Chungcheongbuk-do, Gyeonggi-do, and Seoul, the capital of Gangwon-do. The symbolism of the origin of the two rivers alone is a must in the Taebaek tour.
Nakdong River Origin, Hwangji Pond
Hwangji Pond is located in Hwangji Park in the center of Taebaek city. The large cover stone, “Starting from the 1,300-liter example of the Nakdong River,” indicates that it was the birthplace of the Nakdong River. The large pond inside the park surrounded by buildings is the Hwangji Pond. Hwangji Pond, which retains the legend of the greedy emperor, flows more than 5,000 tons of water a day to the south.
Way to Geomryongso

Geomryongso, beyond Samsuyeong, is 1.5 km from the entrance of the parking lot. The road is flat and the forest is lush, making it ideal for trekking. After meeting the trees that keep the story, such as mountain mulberry, hawthorn, yellowwood, ash, and ash trees, after passing through a small wooden bridge, a path leading to the forest of Japanese oak trees, often called larch. The snow scene of the Japanese oak tree forest road lined up in a row is beautiful. Geomryongso is spring water from limestone caves that rises to 2,000 tons per day. There is no freezing around Geomryongso with an average water temperature of 9 ℃. Even in the middle of winter, it seems as if the dragon is still alive. The stream that started at Geomryongso flows down as a small cow, and finally begins within the sea of the West Sea.

Geomyongso Stream
Travel information

Taebaeksan Snow Festival
-Address: 168 Cheonjedan-gil, Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do
-Inquiries: 033-550-2828

http://festival.taebaek.go.kr/

Restaurants near

Taesung Silbi Restaurant: Korean beef roasted meat / 8 Gamcheon-ro, Taebaek-si / 033-552-5287

Kim Seobang Four Chicken Ribs: Chicken Ribs / 7-1, Jangnam 1-gil, Taebaek-si / 033-553-6378

Namcheonggol Korean Beef: Korean beef roasted meat / 17 Munhwa-ro 3-gil, Taebaek-si / 033-552-5015
Taebaek Chicken Ribs: Chicken Ribs, Welfare-ri / 10 Jungangnam 1-gil, Taebaek-si / 033-553-8119
Cottage depletion: Steamed fish, steamed tofu / 304 Baekdudaegan-ro, Taebaek-si / 033-553-7388

Rooms

O2 Resort: 861 Seohak-ro, Taebaek-si / 033-580-7000

Meridian Hotel: 8, Hwangji Pond Road, Taebaek-si / 033-553-1266

http://www.merdian.co.kr/

Taebaek Plateau Natural Recreation Forest: 153, Myeonggol-gil, Taebaek-si / 033-582-7440

http://forest.taebaek.go.kr/html/intro.html

※ The above information was created in December 2013, and may change later, so be sure to check it before you travel.

item.title: Enjoy the view of the canyon along the stream of the Nakdong River, the gorge train V-train of the Baekdudaegan - Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do, Korea
item.description:
V-train running through the canyon of Baekdu-daegan

Enjoy the view of the canyon along the stream of the Nakdong River, the gorge train V-train of the Baekdudaegan

Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do, Korea

The view of the gorge created by the stream of the Nakdong River spreads out of the car window. You will never see it when you travel by car. It is a scenery that can only be met by climbing the V-train and Baekdu-daegan gorge train. The pine trees growing in the rocks and the beautifully colored larch are as close to touching as you can. Let's get on a three-car train that will make your memories unforgettable.
The three-day V-Train that travels between Cheoram Station in Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do and Buncheon Station in Bonghwa-gun, Gyeongsangbuk-do three times a day, is a three-car tourist train that meets closely the gorge of the canyon created by the stream of the Nakdong River. Because it is a train that passes deeply through the V-shaped canyon, it has the name V-train. From Cheoram, you will travel by train for about 1 hour and 10 minutes from Seokpo Station and Seungbu Station to Yangwon Station and Bidong Station to reach Buncheon.
The picturesque scenery that stretches out of the window is only accessible by train. This is because Seungbu Station, Yangwon Station, and Bidong Station are not connected by road and cannot be reached by car. It is also the reason why many travelers make a reservation and take the Gorge Train between Baekdu-daegan. Taebaek Cheoram Station and Bonghwa Buncheon Station, where trains depart, are always crowded with excitement and excitement.
V-train running through the canyon of Baekdu-daegan

It is also worth taking a short trip to Cheoram while waiting for the Baekdu-daegan train departing from Cheoram. Cheoram is the largest coal mine facility in Korea built during the Japanese occupation. As coal was transported to the whole country through this place, many people once lived, but it is still as if the clock stopped in the 1970s. Around the Cheoram Station, there are murals depicting the stories of former workers at the Tantanjang and their families. When you cross the bridge in front of Cheoram Station, the empty houses lined up along the stream show an unusual scenery.

An unusual scenery around Cheoram Station
People who want to take the Baekdu-daegan Gorge Train at Cheoram Station are reminded of the expectation of a train trip. The appearance of the train waiting for travelers on the platform is also impressive. A locomotive that resembles a baby tiger that has been walking around Baekdu-daegan and a train with an exotic yet cute pink appearance catches the eye.
V-train waiting at Cheoram Station platform
The train interior is also different from the regular train. It is divided into two rows of seats along the car window and seats for two people to sit side by side. The ceiling was decorated with luminous lights to shine when passing through a dark tunnel.
V-train inside
There are only three trains, but there are also crews who are in charge of broadcasting and information, and there are also shops where you can buy snacks.
V-train crew
The train departing from Cheoram Station passes the simple station, Dongjeom Station, and speeds up to Seokpo Station. The full-scale canyon tour begins after Seokpo Station. The train, which ran at about 60 km / h, passed through Seokpo Station and ran at a speed of around 25 km / h, slowly pulling the scenery out of the window.
A traveler who captures the scenery spread out through the window
There are also various views of the scenery spreading out the window. Some travelers are busy moving to capture the scenery, while others sit there and enjoy the scenery silently. In order to record the itinerary as a video, there are people who leave the camera at the end of the train at all times.
Traveler with video at the end of the train
At Seungbu Station, famous for the phrase “three pyeong in the sky and three pyeong in the land,” you can stop at the station for about 10 minutes and feel the atmosphere of the simple station in Oji Village. The unexplored gorge reaches its peak in the section from Seungbu Station to Yangwon Village. The V-train runs along the stream of the Nakdong River, which originates from Taebaek and flows south, as if stroking the gorge of the gorge.
V-train stopped at Seungbu Station
Yangwon Station is a station called “the first private history of our country”. There were no trains in Yangwon Village located between Seungbu Station and Non-dong Station. In order to take the train, residents had to walk to Seungbu Station or Nondong Station.
Yangwon Station, Korea's first private-sector history
Residents who could not bear to buy cement themselves made a small history, and finally the train started to stand. At that time, the history and simple toilet made by the residents still remain.
Yangwon Station Simple Toilet
The scenery inside Yangwon Station, where small wooden chairs and old TVs bring back memories, is beautiful. There are also difficulties selling dried wild herbs, medicinal plants, potato rice cake, and corn. It's a busy time for a quiet Oji village.
The naval war in Yangwon Station
If you are a trekking traveler, you can also walk on the “Zermatt Road” from Yangwon Village to Bidong Village. Zermatt and Buncheon Station, where Switzerland's glacial express train departs, have a sisterhood relationship, and the newly-named “Zermatt Road” is a road used by villagers in the past.
V-Train stopped at the non-dong station where the inhabitants lived
It is also good to walk with two feet as a friend of the sound of the canyon. Although it is not long as it is about 2.2km, you can experience the harmony of nature with the valley and mountain path.
Zermatt Road connecting Yangwon Station and Bidong Station

There are spaces on the train where you can leave another memory, soothing the regret of the train journey running towards the final station. You can write a simple note and leave it on the wall of a train, or buy a postcard to tell a story. If you put it in the mailbox on the train, it will be delivered to you in a month and you will be able to reflect on the memories of your trip.

Memo board that records memories of train travel
The V-Train now arrives at the final station, Buncheon Station, through the non-dong village where the villagers lived. Buncheon station and tiger dolls decorated with Swiss chalet atmosphere present another highlight to travelers.
V-train stamp on the postcard
As more and more travelers visit Buncheon Station, it is full of vitality in the quiet Buncheon Village. The villagers jointly run a restaurant to convey the taste and heart of the mountain village.
Buncheon Station decorated with Swiss chalet atmosphere
It is also possible to rent a bicycle at a bicycle rental station operated by Buncheon Station and take a tour around the town or drive a nearby area using a car sharing service.
Buncheon Station Bicycle Rental
Travel information

Baekdu-daegan Gorge Train V-Train

-Address: 49 Buncheon-gil, Socheon-myeon, Bonghwa-gun, Gyeongsangbuk-do (Buncheon Station)

-Inquiries: 054-1600-7788

-Same as the regular ticket purchase method such as KORAIL homepage, ticket vending machine, etc.

http://www.v-train.co.kr/


Restaurants near
-Ginseng Chicken Ribs: Chicken Ribs / 14 Saejang-gil, Taebaek-si / 033-553-3096

-Wonjo Taeseongsil Restaurant: Hanwoogui / 4 Gamcheon-ro, Taebaek-si / 033-552-5287

-Youwajip: Hanjeongsik / Taebaek-si, Godo-ro 35 / 033-553-4669

http://www.너와집.net/


Rooms
-Dong-A Hotel (Taebaek): 36, Eat Street, Taebaek-si / 033-552-2365, 3605

-Pastel Motel: 16-8 Seohwangji-ro, Taebaek-si / 033-553-1881

-Alps Motel: 16-11 Seohwangji-ro, Taebaek-si / 033-552-2620

http://alpsmotel.kr

※ The above information was updated in November 2017, and may change later, so be sure to check it before you travel.
